meanings.definition: Something that is owed or due
meanings.sent1: She had a debt to her friend for borrowing a book.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't ignore the debt he owed to his family for their support.
meanings.sent3: The debt of gratitude she felt towards her mentor was immense.
meanings.sent4: The debt of kindness he received from strangers warmed his heart.
meanings.sent5: The debt of loyalty between the two friends was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: An obligation to pay or repay
meanings.sent1: His debt to the bank needed to be settled by the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The debt he incurred from his credit card purchases was becoming overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The debt of chores he owed his siblings piled up quickly.
meanings.sent4: The debt of time he promised to his friend was finally repaid.
meanings.sent5: The debt of honesty in their relationship was crucial to maintain trust.

meanings.sent1: Her debt from student loans was a heavy burden on her finances.
meanings.sent2: The country's national debt continued to rise each year.
meanings.sent3: The debt of sleep he accumulated from late nights was catching up to him.
meanings.sent4: The debt of apologies he owed his colleagues was long overdue.
meanings.sent5: The debt of responsibility for the project fell on his shoulders.
